description: Catalogue Description: This course is designed to address issues related to the impact of information technology on health care practitioners and consumers of all ages. Students will learn about and gain experience with practical applications of information technology (Access, handheld devices, telehealth, Internet resources) that improve the qualityof health care communication and delivery and facilitate health care research. Class projects include working with clinical databases and evidence based information sources.
name: HEALTH CARE INFORMATICS: IMPACT ACROSS THE LIFE SPAN
